A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This movie is what happens when disconnected\, 1% bubble-dwellers decide to make a film more accessible to today's youth. They have ideas of what's \"cool\" and \"funny\". Unfortunately\, their notions miss the mark because what people really want regardless of time and age is a story with coherence\, gravitas\, and purpose. (Nowhere to be found in this flick.) TLJ felt like there were too many cooks in the kitchen and like industry people were trying to personally insult one other via shitty characters. I wish they understood that when you have \"rulership\" over something that affects a lot of people\, the work should transcend ego and give back to the community. \n\nHey Disney\, for $1\,000\,000 and some neat toys I'll consider adding more stars......text me.........shhhh.......
